description: From Latin polyspaston (“hoisting-tackle with many pulleys”), from Ancient Greek πολύσπαστον (polúspaston, “compound pulley”).

entries.meaning: A machine consisting of many pulleys
examples: Synonyms: block and tackle, muffle, hoisting-tackle

entries.meaning: (surgical) A machine of many pulleys, formerly used to reduce dislocation
(mechanics) A windlass with many pulleys and truckles
